value.description: Mana flees from {PAWN_nameDef}. {PAWN_pronoun} is unbelievably resistant to direct applications of magic, and {PAWN_possessive} presence acts as a barrier between the material and magical worlds.
[PAWN_nameDef] has a dormant gift for magic. It could awaken if [PAWN_pronoun] experiences something sufficiently grand or terrible, permanently transforming [PAWN_objective] into a powerful mage.
{PAWN_nameDef} is a powerful mage with exceptional sensitivity to mana and other magical phenomena.
{PAWN_nameDef} can use any meditation type. {PAWN_pronoun} gains mana faster from meditating, and meditating takes care of {PAWN_possessive} basic needs.

{PAWN_nameDef} is an exceptionally versatile mage, with a vast repertoire of spells at {PAWN_possessive} disposal. {PAWN_pronoun} may also develop up to two transcendences more than other awakened sorcerers.
{PAWN_nameDef} grows physically and mentally stronger with every spell {PAWN_pronoun} learns.
{PAWN_nameDef} emanates an eldritch aura that enhances nearby spellcasters' powers.
{PAWN_nameDef} is a powerful mage who constantly accumulates mana without the aid of external tools.
{PAWN_nameDef} is a powerful mage, capable of shouldering a heavier arcane load, and possessed of an exceptionally disciplined mind.
{PAWN_nameDef} siphons residual mana from anything {PAWN_pronoun} eats.
{PAWN_nameDef} reinforces {PAWN_possessive} body with mana, improving {PAWN_possessive} capabilities and defenses.
{PAWN_nameDef} stores {PAWN_possessive} mana as a barrier swirling about {PAWN_possessive} body. Damage {PAWN_pronoun} takes is deferred to {PAWN_possessive} mana (at a rate of 4 damage to 1%).

{PAWN_nameDef} possesses a mystical connection to the anima trees. Every 1000 mana {PAWN_pronoun} expends causes an anima tree to sprout, and should {PAWN_pronoun} die, a nearby anima tree will intercede on {PAWN_possessive} behalf, sacrificing itself to restore {PAWN_objective} to life.

{PAWN_nameDef} has an affinity for commanding constructs. When {PAWN_pronoun} affects a construct with a spell, there's a chance it will temporarily join forces with {PAWN_pronoun}. The larger the construct, the less likely it is to be affected.

{PAWN_nameDef} is surrounded in a chaotic field of vital energy. By infusing it into {PAWN_possessive} attacks and spells, {PAWN_pronoun} can stun constructed creatures and shatter magic barriers, and {PAWN_pronoun} is immune to similar blasts {PAWN_objective}self. The energy also improves {PAWN_possessive} vision, makes {PAWN_objective} more elegant in appearance, and protects {PAWN_objective} from heart attacks and comas.

Spirits of civilization and anarchy whisper to {PAWN_nameDef}, showing {PAWN_objective} ways to manipulate plants, soil, and architecture to {PAWN_possessive} own ends. The more sensitive {PAWN_pronoun} is to magic, the more {PAWN_pronoun} benefits from their advice.
Word spells cast by {PAWN_nameDef} cost +7.5% mana but affect all valid targets nearby. The radius is equal to twice {PAWN_possessive} level of magical attunement.

{PAWN_nameDef} generates rock chunks with each spell (and sometimes also makes more valuable metallic resources). On using a spell of the highest level, there is a 10% chance a meteorite will fall somewhere nearby.
{PAWN_nameDef} appears in the dreams of sages around the world, and always in a favorable light. This gradually improves relations with other factions.
Word spells used by {PAWN_nameDef} have a profound influence on the target, breaking unwavering loyalty, reducing resistance, and altering mood and certainty.
{PAWN_nameDef} deals 2.2x damage with enchanted weapons, further increased by {PAWN_possessive} own magic sensitivity.

{PAWN_nameDef} is a font of genius. {PAWN_pronoun} passively contributes to research at a rate scaling with {PAWN_possessive} magic sensitivity; if no research is currently underway, {PAWN_pronoun} instead gradually increases in skill and mana.
{PAWN_nameDef} exudes an enchanting presence, which makes others love {PAWN_objective} more than almost anything else in existence.

{PAWN_nameDef} is all but immune to high temperatures. In close-range combat, {PAWN_pronoun} repeatedly unleashes flame novas, and {PAWN_possessive} spells drench hostile entities and structures in highly flammable oils.
{PAWN_nameDef} has a mystically calming presence which blankets a wide area.

Anyone whom {PAWN_nameDef} kills is shortly thereafter raised in {PAWN_possessive} service. This second life only lasts for three days; magically deaf individuals, as well as those who are already under this effect, cannot be raised in this way.

{PAWN_nameDef} crackles with the power of lightning. {PAWN_pronoun} shocks anything {PAWN_pronoun} strikes in melee, while {PAWN_possessive} spells cause lightning to rain down upon foes. Even devices which absorb lightning respond to {PAWN_possessive} presence.

Whenever {PAWN_nameDef} undergoes an event that would awaken a latent sorcerer, a man in black appears. If {PAWN_pronoun} fulfills a condition that would awaken a latent sorcerer, there is a persistent but very small chance for men in black to appear nearby.

{PAWN_nameDef} conjures stars with each spellcast, which light the way for friends and blind foes. {PAWN_pronoun} is also sustained by bright light; while bathed in it, {PAWN_pronoun} takes far longer to grow hungry.
Capable of sudden and unnatural movements, {PAWN_nameDef} can dodge blows with ease and jump far further. {PAWN_pronoun} can even leap great distances without the aid of artifacts or spells.

{PAWN_nameDef} has a body of Elemental Earth. {PAWN_pronoun} no longer bleeds, surgeries cannot fail on {PAWN_objective}, and {PAWN_possessive} bodily functions are greatly enhanced.\n\n{PAWN_possessive} mystic potential has been stymied as a result of this change; {PAWN_pronoun} can no longer gain new transcendences.
When {PAWN_nameDef} uses a conjuration psycast, interplanar backlash damages everything around the endpoint. The radius improves with {PAWN_possessive} attunement level, up to level 6.

When {PAWN_nameDef} uses a conjuration psycast, interplanar backlash damages everything that isn't an ally between and around the target points. If {PAWN_pronoun} chooses for such a spell's start and end points to be the same, the radius of the effect instead increases to that of {PAWN_possessive} attunement level.

{PAWN_nameDef} is immune to the harmful effects of most gases. {PAWN_pronoun} turns invisible while surrounded by gas, and {PAWN_possessive} spells conjure dust or other loose materials to blind affected foes.
{PAWN_nameDef} is a giant among magi.
{PAWN_nameDef} moves faster and can cast conjuration spells from up to twice as far away.
{PAWN_nameDef} conjures food whenever {PAWN_pronoun} casts spells. {PAWN_possessive} intrinsic magic also seems to keep {PAWN_objective} better-rested.

{PAWN_nameDef} can transform {PAWN_possessive} arcane load into blasts of destructive magic, even while {PAWN_pronoun} is performing other tasks. This attack's range scales with {PAWN_possessive} magic sensitivity.
{PAWN_nameDef} becomes invisible if {PAWN_pronoun} hasn't attacked or cast an ability recently.
{PAWN_nameDef} drains the life from nearby plants to replenish {PAWN_possessive} own vitality, and {PAWN_pronoun} siphons mana over time from nearby hostile magic-users.
{PAWN_nameDef} inflicts heightened regeneration, toughness, and disease resistance on nearby allies.
{PAWN_nameDef} periodically receives high-quality food from beyond. While meditating, {PAWN_possessive} meditation mana gain rate speeds up this process.

{PAWN_nameDef} dreams new beings into existence. Every 24 hours, an ephemeral, fragile individual is manifest from the aether near {PAWN_objective}; they don't need to eat or sleep, and are allied with {PAWN_objective}. Additional such individuals are spawned per every additional 100% magic sensitivity.
{PAWN_nameDef} manifests a doppelganger. If it dies, it will respawn from {PAWN_objective} after a delay, sped up by meditating or casting spells. Artificial body parts are not duplicated.
{PAWN_nameDef} has an incredibly powerful mind, and {PAWN_pronoun} emits a cerebral effect that stimulates learning and improves magic sensitivity.

{PAWN_nameDef} looks into the minds of those near {PAWN_objective}, copying the skills of nearby higher-leveled individuals and adding them to {PAWN_possessive} own experience. {PAWN_pronoun} may also learn spells simply by being affected by them enough times.
{PAWN_nameDef} gains mana from the act of eating, and ingesting enough nutrition may produce a random elixir.
{PAWN_nameDef} is a better speaker and regains all but the last 10% mana spent on Word spells.
{PAWN_nameDef} is physically and mystically empowered by the darkness, but is weakened by bright light. Becoming inspired or entering a mental break will darken the sun, causing an eclipse.
{PAWN_nameDef} gains armor and arcane load recovery rate as it gets colder.
Whenever {PAWN_nameDef} casts a spell, it creates a zone at the target's position in which {PAWN_possessive} cognition and magic sensitivity are enhanced. Only one such zone may exist at any time.

Whenever {PAWN_nameDef} spellcasts, the residual magic influences nearby plants to grow faster, and nearby non-hostile buildings to be repaired. The effect scales with {PAWN_possessive} sensitivity to magic.\n\nCasting a spell will also heal one random injury from a nearby random pawn; the heal's strength scales with the recipient's sensitivity to magic.
While in water, {PAWN_nameDef} moves faster and is protected from damage. Blasts of water emit from the location of {PAWN_possessive} spellcasts.

Animals randomly become tame in the presence of {PAWN_nameDef}. This effect can occur over long distances, and its frequency is based on {PAWN_possessive} magic sensitivity.\n\nWhen {PAWN_pronoun} affects an animal with a spell, its health is either boosted (if non-hostile) or impaired (if hostile).
{PAWN_nameDef} has enhanced sight and a supernaturally far reach - both {PAWN_possessive} abilities and attacks can be cast from much further away.
{PAWN_nameDef} has a 34% chance to stun anyone {PAWN_pronoun} damages or bespells. The duration scales with the victim's sensitivity to magic.

{PAWN_nameDef} receives otherworldly impressions of {PAWN_possessive} surroundings whenever {PAWN_pronoun} spellcasts, improving {PAWN_possessive} senses and manipulation. The effectâ€™s duration increases the more mana is spent, but its effect decays over time.

{PAWN_nameDef} is immune to all manner of poisons, venoms, and harmful alchemies; to an extent, {PAWN_pronoun} is even resistant to disease and foodborne illness. {PAWN_pronoun} can cure someone of any such afflictions (except a bloodborne chemical dependency) simply by affecting them with a spell.

{PAWN_nameDef} is surrounded by winds that hold {PAWN_objective} and nearby allies aloft, keeping them from triggering traps and allowing them to move faster, heedless of the difficulty of the terrain.

{PAWN_nameDef} is shrouded in an arcane barrier, transforming incoming damage into arcane load. If {PAWN_pronoun} exceeds {PAWN_possessive} arcane load limit, the barrier will vanish and cannot be reformed for a day - though this can be speeded up via meditation.
{PAWN_nameDef} produces luciferium by spellcasting.
{PAWN_nameDef} has a bound personal demiplane which {PAWN_pronoun} can store and retrieve items from. While meditating, the demiplane may randomly acquire more items.
{PAWN_nameDef} has a chance to cause good events to occur on killing another person. {PAWN_pronoun} also gains mana from killing other beings.

{PAWN_nameDef} summons an insect hive every time {PAWN_pronoun} spends 20% mana, and {PAWN_possessive} presence pacifies all but the largest insectoids. A pacified insectoid behaves like a wild animal, though it doesn't wander very far, and even if it was originally protecting a hive it will no longer take care of it.

When {PAWN_nameDef} spellcasts, the residual magic transforms into raw, shapeless life-force. After 1000% mana is spent, the accumulated life-force coalesces into a new person. The life-force takes cues from the life of {PAWN_nameDef}, so the newborn will have the same allegiances and seems to come from a similar walk of life.

{PAWN_nameDef} has a chance to inflict madness upon foes {PAWN_pronoun} affects with spells. More magically sensitive victims are more vulnerable, but levels of magical attunement reduce susceptibility to the effect.

{PAWN_nameDef} is physically, mentally, and mystically empowered by being in a romantic relationship (or unconditionally if aromantic). {PAWN_possessive} romantic partners and bonded animals receive a physical and mood buff too.
While {PAWN_nameDef} is unburdened by arcane load, {PAWN_possessive} flight speed is vastly increased.

{PAWN_nameDef} uses chaos magic to break solid earth and structures apart much faster. {PAWN_pronoun} also releases this magic in a shockwave around the targets of {PAWN_possessive} spells, damaging enemy buildings in a radius scaling with the spell's level.
{PAWN_nameDef} augments {PAWN_possessive} melee attacks with Void magic, dealing bonus damage that ignores armor and most forms of damage resistance.
{PAWN_nameDef} grows in size over time, making {PAWN_objective} more physically powerful. Spending mana reverses this transformation to some extent.
Random corpses appear near {PAWN_nameDef} as {PAWN_pronoun} spends mana. {PAWN_pronoun} also cannot be harmed by the living dead, such as ghouls or shamblers.
Random corpses appear near {PAWN_nameDef} as {PAWN_pronoun} spends mana.
{PAWN_nameDef} is constantly inspired - whenever one inspiration ends, the next begins. Those affected by {PAWN_possessive} spells may become inspired as well.

{PAWN_nameDef} periodically conjures tame animals of a specific type to {PAWN_possessive} location. This effect occurs faster while meditating. New animals won't be summoned if doing so would cause the sum body size of all current ones to exceed twice {PAWN_possessive} attunement level.
While {PAWN_possessive} mana is greater than 35%, {PAWN_nameDef} is partially pulled into the spiritual realms, allowing {PAWN_objective} to move through solid objects.

{PAWN_nameDef} is supernaturally gifted at healing. {PAWN_pronoun} heals anyone {PAWN_pronoun} tends to and always succeeds at surgery. {PAWN_pronoun} also somehow acquires herbal medicine after spending 10% mana or meditating for long enough.

When a spellcaster or latent sorcerer perishes nearby, {PAWN_nameDef} 'hoards' away some of their magic. This hoard is woven into a ward that strengthens {PAWN_possessive} spellcasting and health, as well as expends itself to negate incoming damage. More powerful sorcerers grant more power to the hoard.\n\n{PAWN_pronoun} also cannot be affected by the spells of hostile magic-users.

{PAWN_nameDef} is a mix of magic and materium. {PAWN_possessive} physical and mental attributes are greatly amplified by {PAWN_possessive} magic sensitivity, and {PAWN_possessive} magical powers are further boosted by the presence of other magic-users.

{PAWN_nameDef} can strip the magical sensitivity from others. A second application of this ability kills the victim, extracting their magical attunement into crystallized arcane shards. Awakened sorcerers cannot be slain by this ability.

On eating the corpse of a fellow awakened or transcendent mage, {PAWN_nameDef} will develop one of their awakenings or transcendences, as well as potentially gain increase in magical attunement. Ordinary food, however, does little for {PAWN_objective}.
{PAWN_nameDef} can bring the dead back to life, temporarily turning them invincible. If {PAWN_pronoun} dies, {PAWN_pronoun} will automatically use this power on {PAWN_objective}self.
{PAWN_nameDef} can assert mental control over others. This costs a level of magical attunement.
{PAWN_nameDef} can attune others to magic. This power always succeeds on those without any attunement, but is likelier to fail the more attuned the target is. A target who fails three times dies.
{PAWN_nameDef} can start others on the path to mystic awakening, induce awakening in a latent sorcerer, or even grant a second awakening to another.

When {PAWN_nameDef} is slain, {PAWN_pronoun} will possess someone else, replacing their mind with {PAWN_possessive} own. The only way to prevent this is to strike {PAWN_objective} with an enchanted weapon, which suppresses this ability for a day, or to kill {PAWN_objective} within a day after possessing a new body.
Sends the caster hurtling into the air and ensures a safe landing at a distant location.

The caster erects a dam that cuts the victim off from the flows of magic. The dam can only be brought down if the victim spends at least a full day meditating or achieves a new level of magical attunement. A second application will kill the victim, but results in a lengthy cooldown. Psycasters killed by this ability leave behind physical manifestations of their magical attunement.\n\nThis ability can't kill awakened sorcerers. Its cooldown lengthens by an order of magnitude per the victim's level of magical attunement, to a max of 1 quadrum.

The caster sends the target on a vision trance for 3 days, attuning them to magic. The more attuned the target, the less likely they are to succeed. Anyone who fails three trances is immediately slain by something dark.\n\nCan't be cast on downed targets.

Knocks the target out for 3 days and has an additional effect depending on the target:
-Ordinary individuals are transformed into Latent Sorcerers. This incurs no cooldown.
-Latent Sorcerers have a 33% chance to become awakened.
-Awakened Sorcerers have a 33% chance to gain a second awakening; this cannot grant someone more than two awakened traits.

The caster unleashes a dark working that destroys the target object on the world map. Everything within the area is reduced to dust, which is then pulled into the sky and falls down over a wide area for days. Employing this ability will cause relations with all factions to break down. \n\nThis ability's cooldown only recharges while meditating.
The presence of a nearby magic void is dampening magic sensitivity.
Awakened luminaries act as a wellspring of refined mana, improving nearby spellcasting.
Emission of refined mana, empowering nearby spellcasters (but not oneself).
The presence of a nearby awakened luminary improves spellcasting.
Mana channeled through the body, improving its capabilities and defenses.
Mana channeled through the body, improving its capabilities and defenses.
The albatross mastered the riding of the winds long before man dreamed of flight. Bards invoke its name to describe magi surrounded by barriers of living wind.
Every 1000 mana {PAWN_nameDef} expends summons an anima tree somewhere nearby. If {PAWN_pronoun} dies, {PAWN_pronoun} will instantly respawn at a nearby anima tree, killing the tree.
Bards invoke the hardy cockroach, which can seemingly survive without its head for an extended period of time, to describe mystics for whom grievous wounds are little issue.
The crane is a natural exemplar of poise, balance, and grace. Bards invoke its name to describe magi with a preternatural surfeit of the same.
Elemental Earth can be used to fashion - or in this case, replace - anatomy.

The goldfinch is a notable member of the dawn chorus - the birds whose song accompanies the sunrise each morning. Bards invoke the goldfinch to describe sorcerers who receive a restorative and protective blessing on a daily basis.
Bards invoke the honeybee, who works its entire life to provide nourishment for others, to describe sorcerers whose talents spontaneously manifest food.
Bards invoke the many painful stings of a hornet swarm to describe magi with endless destructive magic at their disposal.
Currently not benefitting from the hummingbird spirit. Invisibility will resume after 1 hour. Attacking or casting an ability will reset the timer.
As it is a ubiquitous symbol of protection and health, bards invoke the ladybug to describe magi whose mere presence protects and heals allies.

Every 24 hours, manifests a number of fragile, magically-sensitive individuals who don't need to eat or sleep. These individuals disappear after 24 hours, just in time for the next group to spawn. Every 100% magical sensitivity results in one 'locustspawn' per day.
Bards invoke the magpie, commonly regarded as a thief or as a sign of fortune, to describe magi who seem to regularly stumble across fortunes.
Bards invoke the bats of dusk and night to describe sorcerers whose powers flourish in the dark.
While below 16 degrees Celsius, provides bonuses to armor and arcane load recovery rate. The lower the temperature, the stronger the bonuses.
Bards invoke the water-spewing, aquatic orca to describe sorcerers with an affinity for water.
Bards invoke the long-beaked pelican to describe mystics who can conjure effects from far distances.
Bards invoke the bat and its potent echolocation to describe magi who can 'echolocate' via spellcasting.
The pitohui's body is replete with deadly poison; bards invoke its name to describe psychics unaffected by even the most powerful toxins.
Bards invoke the quelea and the vast flocks it forms to describe aeromancers who cause themselves and their compatriots to fly above the ground.
Currently being kept aloft by magical winds guided by a nearby transcendent quelea.
Bards invoke the raven, often associated with wisdom and insight, to describe mystics beset by visions from beyond.
Bards invoke the scarab and its gleaming carapace to describe magi surrounded in shimmering barriers of impenetrable force.
Sorcerers who conjure luciferium are often associated with its signature color.
Every 20% mana spent will create an insect hive nearby.
Spending 1000% mana will create a new person with the same faction, ideoligion, and general background as this character.
Bards invoke the swift, a bird named for its immense speed, to describe aeroturges who fly at unparalleled speed.
Bards invoke the uhu, which swells in size dramatically as a threat response, to describe sorcerers who rapidly grow in size.
Bards invoke the unsettling, leering visage of the whalehead stork to describe warlocks who exude a storm of misery and terror.
Currently capable of moving through solid obstacles. This effect can only be maintained above 35% mana.
Will regain phasing once mana exceeds 35%.
Those blessed by the dragon spirit hoard magic taken forcibly from other sorcerers, and slowly consume this hoard to empower their magic and health.
Bards invoke the idea of a being wrought from magical will to describe those whose physical and mental selves seem the fiat of magic.
Enhanced mystic strength derived from the presence of other nearby magicians.

A dam in the astral plane. It can only be cured by spending at least a full day meditating, or by achieving a new level of magical attunement. If an erinys uses antimagic censure on this character again, the dam will constrict, killing this character.
Those blessed by the harpy spirit can only truly be sated by the flesh of other sorcerers.
Temporary nigh-invincibility due to recent resurrection by spiritual phoenixfire.
A three-day transformative coma in which one adapts to newfound magical power.

On death, wraith-sorcerers transfer their consciousnesses to another magically sensitive non-sorcerous being. However, this transfer can't occur if it's been used within the last day, nor if they've been struck by a sentient weapon within the last day.
{PAWN_nameDef} is a master of the simplest cantrips. {PAWN_pronoun} can cast most 1st-level spells without expending any mana.

Once a day, {PAWN_nameDef} can draw upon a convergence of mystical power, greatly enhancing {PAWN_possessive} magic for an hour. Outside of this period, {PAWN_pronoun} finds spellcasting more arduous.
The caster draws on the nearest leylines. For the next hour, spellcasting incurs far less arcane load and costs far less mana.
Vastly reduces arcane load gain and completely eliminates spells' mana costs.
{PAWN_nameDef} is a master of the simplest cantrips. {PAWN_pronoun} regains mana from casting them; only the most mana-hungry 1st-level spells will impact {PAWN_possessive} mana pool.
{PAWN_nameDef} is a genius magician. {PAWN_pronoun} gains experience with every spell cast.

Once a day, {PAWN_nameDef} can draw upon a convergence of mystical power, greatly enhancing {PAWN_possessive} magic for an hour. Outside of this period, {PAWN_pronoun} loses extra mana with each spell cast.
The caster draws on the nearest leylines. For the next hour, spellcasting incurs far less arcane load and all mana spent returns to the caster, ready to be used again.
Vastly reduces arcane load gain and completely eliminates spells' mana costs.
